Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Model
Description: Small clump of clay hastily fashioned in the likeness of a hoe. An elongated section represents the handle while the curved extremity represents the blade. The hoe was one of the essential tools used during the foundation ritual. It was used to dig the foundation trench once the plan of the temple had been drawn.
